study.citation: Prostate, Lung, Colorectal, and Ovarian (PLCO) Cancer Screening Trial

patients.bullet: Mean age not stated, but between 60 and 64 years

study.intervention: Serial testing of levels of prostate-specific antigen Every one year Duration of screening 6 years Mean tests performed: 5.1 tests per male PSA level defined as abnormal: 4 ng per mL
study.comparison: Usual care Contamination rate: 52% of controls Mean tests performed: 2.7 tests per male (reported)

study.citation: European Randomized Study of Screening for Prostate Cancer (ERSPC)
study.intervention: Serial testing of levels of prostate-specific antigen Every 4 years Duration of screening 13 years Mean tests performed: 1.7 tests per male PSA level defined as abnormal: 3 ng per mL
study.comparison: Usual care Contamination rate: 31% of controls Mean tests performed: not reported

patients.bullet: Cohort born in 1930-1939 also included in ERSPC
Cohort born in 1940-1944 are not included in ERSPC

study.intervention: Serial testing of levels of prostate-specific antigen Every 2 years Duration of screening 14 years Mean tests performed: 3.9 tests per male PSA level defined as abnormal: 3 ng per mL
study.comparison: Usual care Contamination rate: 31% of controls (presumed based on rate in ERSPC) Mean tests performed: not reported

study.comparison: Usual care Contamination rate: not reported Mean tests performed: not reported
